fields.headline: Letter: Lord Lane
fields.bodyText: Ruth Runcieman writes: I was one of those who had the privilege of being a member of the Lane Committee on the Mandatory Sentence for Homicide set up in 1992 under the auspices of the Prison Reform Trust. I have always remembered Geoffrey Lane's (obituary, August 23) first remark to us at our first meeting. "I am rather nervous," he said. "You ought to know that I have never chaired a committee before." We were thereafter led on a journey of unfailing intellectual rigour, conducted with equally unfailing modesty, humour and, above all, humanity.
